item.title: Reading Summary
item.description: To write down things while reading. Li, Feng, Russell Lundholm, and Michael Minnis. “A Measure of Competition Based on 10-K Filings.” Journal of Accounting Research 51, no. 2 (2013): 399–436. Measure of competition based on textual analysis in 10K. Competition is the cross-elasticity of demand. Common competition measures like four-company ratio and HHI lack precision in measuring individual firms’ operating and investing decision; they are also only based on very limited public firm samples; they also depend largely on the definition of industry.

item.title: Notes on Arya et al., 2000
item.description: The paper: Arya, A., J. Fellingham, Jonathan Glover , D. Schroeder, and Gilbert Strang. “Inferring Transactions from Financial Statements.” Contemporary Accounting Research vol. 17, (January 01, 2000): 366-385. The Question Given a set of financial statement \(x\), what is the “best guess” of the underlying transaction vector \(y\)? The Solution Four steps to form the solution: Build a algebric representation for accounting process: \(Ay=x\) (\(A\) is the double entry matrix) Identify the fundamental subspaces of \(A\).
